description:
A cold upper trough brings cooling temperatures and potential for
snow across Southcentral tonight and Wednesday. Precipitation is
expected to start as rain this evening in most areas and
transition to snow or a mix of rain and snow after midnight. Lower
elevations across the Anchorage Bowl to the Matanuska Valley
should stay predominately rain with an occasional mix of snow into
Wednesday with no snow accumulations expected on the roadways.
However, higher elevations across the Anchorage Bowl and Matanuska
Valley, and the northern Susitna Valley could see a couple of
inches of new snow overnight. Conditions will likely become more
showery Wednesday and Thursday and stay on the cooler side.
